posts.post_content:
Posted By: Jason L
anyone got a nice one in VGish shape?

Thanks,
Jason

Posted By: Jason L
I'll pay a good price if it presents well.

Posted By: Bob
Jason- I have no clue why Schulte is so scarce. I know I have tried to find a nice upgrade for a couple of years and when a higher quality Schulte goes up for bid it gets crazy money. Both Tim N. and I when writing our articles on the T207 set noted the card is a tougher common, but based on how rarely the card comes up and the prices paid for it, I must assume either we have a Schulte relative buying at all costs or the card is just flat out scarcer than we all thought. Based on distribution there is no reason for this. I am stumped. Good luck though!
tbob

Posted By: Mike Frohme
Schulte is definitely not one of the usual suspects.

A little odd that a PSA 6 Sculte went last week on eBay for less than other 6's of much more common players over the last month (e.g. Wolverton, Konetchy).  

I'll admit that I didn't look closely at any of the scans so that could be the simple determining factor.

--
Mike

Posted By: Jason L
Last week?!?!?
A PSA 6???!!!
Are you kidding!>!>!?!?!?
figures, I was away on vacation.

TBob,
I am glad to hear it is not just me.  I have actually been looking for this card for more than a year now.  Everytime one comes up (agreed, very seldom), I am the underbidder.  You know why?  Because I cannot bring myself to pay more than I did for my Victor Saier (PSA 1)!!!!  No way was I under the impression that the Schulte was one of the tough Cubs cards.  I swallowed hard to get the Saier, and have since resigned myself to the fact that acquiring a Ward Miller will take a lottery win.  No way did I think I would need to wait this long and be so upwardly mobile in my price for a Schulte.

I find your commentary both disheartening and encouraging at the same time.
Perhaps something is at work behind the scenes, as you say. [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/sad.gif[/IMG]

Posted By: Steve Murray
Maybe six or seven years ago or so there was a Schulte family member buying Schulte cards. I sold her a couple.  At the time I didn't have the impression that she was hoarding them like Brian does with the Miller Obaks and Zeenuts.

Posted By: Todd C
what would a VG   or VG/EX sell for ?


I might have one..
